review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe 2 GiÆ°á»ng Ä‘Æ¡n NhÃ¬n ra Biá»ƒn
review.comment_positive:
Warm welcome from the staff. Great localisation with a nice 5min boat shuttle experience to join the main hotel.

Breakfast buffet offer a large choice.
Breakfast time was from 6 to 10.30am, I'd recommend going after 8.30 as it was crowded with many Vietnamese families before that time.

For lunch or dinner time, we tried the Pavillon space to order food as it is more peaceful and the atmosphere seemed nice. Ordered food were tasty, refined and well presented. The view is particularly enjoyable. We also tried the inside Akoya restaurant in which we found the food specially delicious! 

Globally, a great location to enjoy the view and atmosphere with complete services, equipped fitness center, indoor and outdoor swimming pool...
review.comment_negative:
Room was conformed to the global description but some comments : Pillow were super soft, I was not used to this kind of shamallow's sensation at first.
This type of room with ocean view had a small balcony, in a corner part. The view was OK but we couldn't enjoy a panoramic view of the ocean. I guess it's fine if you want to benefit from the wall shadow to avoid the sun...
For this hotel, it can be more interesting taking a room in higher floor and with swimming pool view if you'd prefer to see the outdoor flow of customers and have a direct view on the beach.

ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ‘§â€ğŸ‘¦A lot of families and groups were present, even in week days. I guess this location is popular for families with children or large groups, it can be a bit noisy during rush hours.
Better find the right time slot if you prefer a calm moment to relax (probably between 1 to 3pm seems to have fewer people).

 ğŸ–We didn't go swimming in the sea. I think that the sea water in this area is not that suitable to enjoy a great swimming experience. However I'd suggest better going to the beach in the afternoon, as the water goes down in the morning ; you need to wait for the sea water to reach the sand to avoid swimming in the mud.. 
 You need to take the stairs to go to the outdoor area. For people who need accessible route, need a detour to the hall and ask for a shuttle.

We arrived on Sunday afternoon, we couldn't really enjoy a late afternoon walk as we could smell pungent odors (heavy smell of sewers or trash... ?). Better enjoy the fresh sea air in the morning or other days...hopefully that didn't happen every day

review.comment_positive:
I absolutely loved this hotel! It was everything a hotel should be and great value for money. My room had ocean view overlooking Halong Bay. It was fantastic although the weather was quite gloomy. Not sure if it was pollution or just cloudy. The room was quiet. I had the most comfortable bed with the best pillows I have ever had in a hotel (and I travel a lot).  I loved the HOT shower too and that the room also had a bathtub.
My phone did not charge so I was using an outlet downstairs. One of the staff noticed and sent a charger up to my room without me having to ask. A very nice gesture.
Everything was clearly marked. The indoor swimming pool was luxury and about 28m long! Both the women and men's dressing rooms near the swimming pool have their own private jacuzzi, sauna and steam room for free use! I also had a spa treatment which was also amazing!
The breakfast options were fabulous with a wide variety for all tastes and cultures.

I ate a hamburger at one of the restaurants. Although the beef was good, the bacon was hard and full of fat which I had to take out. Otherwise, overall good quality of food.

The staff were amazing and very helpful.
The speedboats run every 20 minutes (takes 3-5 min) 24 hours which is fantastic!
Would definitely come back in a heartbeat!

There is a massive cleanup for the plastic pollution in the water at Halong Bay. I was pleasantly surprised to have only  seen 3 pieces of trash floating next to the shore. This was something I was very worried about. I stayed at the hotel and went for a day trip cruise and that was perfect!
review.comment_negative:
A few thoughts to consider:

The water bottles are located in the bathroom- so almost missed them! Better to put them in the sleeping area next to the information sheets and menu.

Housekeeping should check the shampoo, conditioner and body wash bottles to make sure they are working properly. The conditioner was not coming out and I asked for it to be refilled. It was, but it still did not come out.. Upon further inspection, the tube inside was blocked so once cleaned out, it worked perfectly!

It is absolutely fine to ask guests to write a review. However, when one is asked to write a good review or rate the hotel as a 10, this leaves a very bad taste. This is an honest review, but something to be cautious of when guests are checking out.

If we go back to ha Long Bay, I would only stay here.

review.comment_positive:
The location is just amazing. This is right where you would want to be when going to see Ha long Bay as you are staying there. The staff goes above and beyond to listen and work towards making the guests feel welcome. At every step(reception, guest enrollment, service, restaurant) it seems everyone is wanting to see how they can help. It was a five star experience.Some special mentions- we loved the service at the buffet. To cater to vegetarian, the actually made customized food(Pho, veg fried rice etc) and brought it out for us
The staff were so considerate and nice and understanding.Buffet staff mentions who really stood out and nice(along with others- cam van,thanh Thao ,tu linh.)

At the reception, Bach Duong and trung Duong and my hung were so helpful. They organized taxi and as it is very difficult in finding people who understand English, My hung became our point of contact to order taxi around the Ha long bay area.

The food and view at the Pavilion restaurant was just amazing.
I just loved the mystery laundry bag scheme. Thank you Vinpearl. We got all our cloths washed at such a reasonable price and sent back in 3 hours(we gave soiled cloths at 5p and amazed to see them back at 8pm)

Im Auto gab es sogar kostenfreies Wasser fÃ¼r uns!
Der Empfang an der Rezeption auf dem Festland war Ã¤uÃŸerst freundlich und zuvorkommend. Uns wurde das GepÃ¤ck abgenommen und zum Zimmer gebracht. Wir sind nach schnellem Check In per Boot auf die Insel zum Hotel gefahren, wo wir ebenfalls unglaublich freundlich empfangen wurden. 
Das Zimmer war sehr groÃŸ mit eigenem Balkon und schÃ¶nem Blick aufs Meers. Die Sauberkeit lies auch nicht zu wÃ¼nschen Ã¼brig! Wir haben uns sofort wie zuhause gefÃ¼hlt und konnten unseren Aufenthalt genieÃŸen.

review.comment_positive: We didnâ€™t like the view of our room so we told our check in reception and they were kind enough to change a room with spectacular view for us ! Our daughter had serious stomach pain and they called a nurse to our room and arranged speed boat to take us to the port and helped with transition to the hospital close by ! They were so thoughtful when we came back from the hospital it was already pass breakfast hour but they allowed us to have some food before we check out. On our way to check out , they came and asked about the well being of our daughter and gave us bottles of water and send us off ! Loved their service and genuine attitude ! The swimming pool was really nice , too
review.comment_negative: Itâ€™s just that you should know every time u go back to ur hotel u need to wait for a speed boat and then take the speed boat back to the hotel , then a tutu , so if u mind the time and the distance then it may not be the best choice ! review.comment_positive: My stay at Vinpearl Resort Ha Long Bay was a mixed experience. The location was fantastic, offering stunning views of the bay, and the staff was friendly and accommodating. However, I couldn't help but notice that the hotel itself was showing signs of age and wear. The need for renovation was evident in various aspects of the property, from the outdated decor to the worn-out facilities. While the cleanliness was maintained, the overall ambiance left something to be desired. With a renovation, this resort has the potential to shine even brighter and provide an even more enjoyable stay for its guests.
review.comment_negative: Another aspect to consider is that there seemed to be limited halal dining options available, which could be a limitation for some guests.

review.room_type: PhÃ²ng Deluxe 2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n
review.comment_positive: An unique hotel in an somewhat unique location (private island) which makes a (free) boat transfer necessary. Very nice property with excellent pool area. Breakfast with stunning views to HaLong Bay and nice choices. Rooms large and comfy. Staff most of the time very friendly.
review.comment_negative: For 5* stars, a bit inconsistent. Some staff members speak great English, some not. Some are very friendly, some not. Most of the time clean rooms, but spots in the bathroom and at outside areas. Some parts of the hotel (stairs, walls) start to look dated already. Buffett dinner not recommended. Feels like a better canteen. The other restaurant is very expensive. Overall, the hotel rooms are very expensive for HaLong. Boat transfer ends at an uninviting area, walking to more downtown areas feels not safe.

The breakfast buffet was outstanding, and the room service was equally impressive.

The boat can take you to the shore every 20 minutes. However, we stayed in the hotel most of the time having visited the biggest local supermarket (Go Halong) one day. review.rating: Luxury stay - Get the King Suite if you can
review.room_type: Suite Executive CÃ³ GiÆ°á»ng Cá»¡ King
review.comment_positive: Stunning!! Absolutely stunning!! I can't recommend this enough. We had a very busy 10 days prior to this, so keep that in mind as it probably played a part in just how much we loved it here. From the luxury entrance to the private jetty to the king suite with dual balcony it was just amazing. We hid away here for two nights, then added a third on as we didn't want to leave. The place was quiet at was early March, but everything was staffed well and open inc the pavilion restaurant which is expensive (for the area) but worth it if you're into a bit of fine dining. The other two night we spend in the room looking out over the sea views and sipping on 1,000,000 wine (about Â£30). We ordered room service as well both nights we we usually can't justify the prices for, but these where reasonable and very, very nice. After a while of eating Pho and spring rolls a juicy burger and chips was a nice taste of home. If you can spring for the King suite although the other rooms did look very good a most seemed to face the sea. The out door and in door pools were great, indoor was heated and the swim up pool bar was a nice touch. My wife had a facial and a massage. She had two else where in Vietnam and these where just as good so worth the extra expense. I tried to save some money by using the free gym which was well kitted out. It's a must go if you're in Ha long bay and want to treat yourself.
